Program a CSS selector with the following declarations: (Note: write all of your selectors in alphabetical order, and use shorthand notation wherever possible)

  • element being selected is a header
  • element being selected class should be equal to header
  • text color should be hexcode ffc700
  • element background color should be hexcode 18354a
  • text font size should be equivalent to 24px
  • element should have a 32px margin on the top and bottom
  • element should be horizontally centered
  • element should have 32px of padding on all four sides
  • element should have a solid, 1px border, color is hexcode ffc700
  • element should be as wide as possible, but no wider than 1100px
  • element should be as high/tall as necessary based on the content within
  • all size/dimension values should be coded in rem units (assume root element font-size: 100%)
exercises.solution: header.header { background-color: #18354a; border: 1px solid #ffc700; color: #ffc700; font-size: 1.5rem; margin: 2rem auto; max-width: 68.75rem; padding: 2rem; }

exercises.instructions:
Program a CSS declaration for the margin property. The value should be based on the following:

  • bottom: 16px
  • top: 24px
  • left: 16px
  • right: 16px

All size/dimension values should be coded in rem units (assume root element font-size: 100%). The value should be coded in the shortest possible style.

  • left: 24px
  • right: 32px

All size/dimension values should be coded in rem units (assume root element font-size: 100%). The value should be coded in the shortest possible style.

  • The div should be as wide as possible, but no wider than 1000px
  • The div should be horizontally centered on the screen.

I'm tired of doing math. I don't want the browser to add all of the margin and padding values to the overall size of my containers. If I say width: 900px, I want the width to be 900px, even after I add margin and padding styles ðŸ˜¢. Program the CSS that will make it so.

Program a CSS rule that will change the color of the background of an element to hex code 2edb00.

Program a CSS rule that will set a background image for an element to an image file named "background.png" that is up one directory from the location of the stylesheet, in a folder named "images". This image should not repeat.

Program a CSS declaration for an element with a class attribute that has a value of "hero" with the following properties:

  • The font size should be four times larger than the parent element font size.
  • The text color should be white.
  • The background should be an image file named "hero-1.jpg", located up two directories from the location of the stylesheet, in a folder named "ui" This image should not repeat.
  • The background image should be as large as possible so the container is completely covered.
  • The container should have a 3rem margin on the bottom.
  • The container should have 2rem's of padding on all four sides.
  • The container should be centered horizontally.
  • The container should have a 5px, black, solid border on all four sides.
  • The container should be no wider than 900px
exercises.solution: .hero { background-size: cover; background: url('../../ui/hero-1.jpg') no-repeat; border: 5px solid black; color: white; font-size: 400%; margin: 0 auto 3rem; max-width: 56.25rem; padding: 2rem; }
